page.title: 04LOCHAR MOSS
page.content: The most prominent feature of this area is the {LOCHAR MOSS.}Mention has already been made of its effect on the roads into the area.In past times it served as a natural moat to protect the town of Dumfries. Its main use was to provide fuel for the people in the district.Tons of pure peat were cut and dried on the moss before being transported by horses and carts thus lowering the level of the moss considerably.The sphagnum moss was used for insulation between the walls of houses and the denser material for fuel.With the coming of the railway giving access to cheap coal from Upper Nithsdale,peat cutting declined greatly. Today a lot of the land has been reclaimed and areas of the moss are presently being reclaimed by extensive drainage work.
